Recruiter at Side Real Estate

Remote | Freelance

GENERAL AREA

PEOPLE OPERATIONS – TALENT

1099 (CONTRACT)

ABOUT SIDE

At Side, we believe everyone should own their path.

As the first company to design an end to end modern brokerage solution, Side is re-imagining the real estate industry from the ground up by combining innovative technology, creative branding expertise, and an experienced leadership team with a mission to empower the world’s leading real estate professionals to own their brand and better serve home buyers and sellers.

In the past two years, with an exceptional team of inSiders, we’ve processed $1B in transactions and raised over $30M in funding from top tier investors like Matrix Partners, Trinity Ventures, and 8VC.

At Side, you’ll have the opportunity to collaborate and innovate your way to success. Becoming an inSider means that you’ll be empowering business leaders to become business owners, all while forging your own path with like-minded entrepreneurs. Join us at Side and own your career, your impact, and your life.

ABOUT THE ROLE

We’re looking for a full-cycle (remote contractor) Recruiter to own a mixture of business and technical hiring. As a full-cycle recruiter, you’ll be responsible for developing and implementing a candidate recruitment strategy. This includes advertising and passive candidate sourcing, acting as the gatekeeper to our culture and screening candidates thoroughly before passing them onto the next round, and creating a superb candidate experience that promotes our employer brand. You’ll own the recruitment of 8-10 roles at a time and manage the relationships with each candidate.

WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING

  • Lead intake discussions with hiring managers, gathering the role requirements and supporting hiring managers in defining the interview process
  • Develop and implement advertising strategies to attract candidates to each role that you own
  • Source potential candidates on major and niche platforms by crafting personalized recruiting emails
  • Phone screen candidates and assess for cultural and role fit, make recommendations to hiring managers on which candidates to move forward with
  • Own candidate relationships and maintain a high close rate per requisition

WHAT WOULD MAKE YOU A STRONG FIT FOR THE ROLE?

  • 5+ years of experience in the recruiting industry with at least 3 years as a full-cycle recruiter
  • Hands-on experience recruiting for Engineering talent (e.g. Tech Leads and Software Engineers)
  • Strong writing skills and can succinctly develop a pitch
  • Critical eye for identifying top talent for specific roles
  • Strong prioritization skills
  • Successful track record of achieving targets
  • Candidate-first mentality
  • Familiarity with Applicant Tracking Systems (specifically Lever)
  • Self-starter with an incredible work ethic

COMPENSATION/PERKS

  • Competitive salary
  • Stock options
  • Best-in-class benefits, including 100% healthcare coverage (medical, vision and dental)
  • Flexible PTO
  • Learning and development credit
  • Pet friendly environment

Side is committed to creating a diverse environment and is an equal opportunity employer. Side does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, parental status, veteran status, or disability status.

Side uses the E-Verify employment verification program.

Our stewardship of the data of many of our customers means that a background and DRE license check is required to join Side. We will, nonetheless, consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in accord with applicable law, including the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

Senior Talent Sourcer – Recruiter at GeoLogics

Remote

We have an opening with a major aerospace company in McLean, VA for a Sr. Talent Sourcer – Recruiter. NOTE: This is a REMOTE job and is a long term stable role (No end date anticipated). US Citizenship is required.

Contractor’s Work Location: Remote

Manager’s Location: McLean, VA

As a member of our team, a Sourcer works closely with our recruiters and hiring managers to develop strategies to find candidates for our IT, Engineering, and Intelligence Analysis organizations. We conceive practical and creative ways to surface leading talent, and we invest a lot of time activating passive candidates through a highly engaged approach. We’re passionate about delivering an awesome candidate experience, and that starts with the first conversation a candidate has with us, which is more often than not with a member of our Sourcing team. We’re seeking a dynamic Sourcer who brings a level of motivation, curiosity and technical capability to our team

  • Work closely with Recruiters and hiring managers to deeply understand requirements of the role, the function and how it fits into the organization
  • Team with Recruiters and hiring managers to manage an efficient model of operation
  • Strategize different ways to build talent pipelines and execute on tactical research, referral generation, events and sourcing campaigns
  • Find, engage and activate passive candidates through the use of Boolean, LinkedIn and alternative search techniques
  • Screen resumes and interview candidates to determine fit
  • Regularly track pipeline activity to share with internal stakeholders
  • Recommend and drive improvements that impact local pipeline areas

Skills Required:

  • 5+ years of technical sourcing experience with a search firm or in-house recruiting team
  • Excellent research/sourcing skills with the ability to dive deep into searches for hard-to-fill reqs
  • Sound candidate engagement approach with ability to activate passive candidates
  • Sharp interview skills with the ability to screen for both technical and cultural qualities
  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate well

Skills Preferred

Prior staffing agency experience. Sourcing certification (AIRS, ERE/Sourcecon, Boolean Blackbelt, etc.) Involved in networking groups, social media, and has genuine interest in new and emerging sourcing methods and technologies.

Experience Required

  • 5+ years technical sourcing experience with a search firm or in-house recruiting team
  • Education Required- High School Diploma
  • Education Preferred- BS or MS Degree plus professional certifications

Career consultants and candidates with lots of short assignments will not be considered. Work ethic, competitiveness, type-a personality trumps having prior experience with the Defense/Intelligence Community. No end date anticipated. This is a long-term stable role for which we are seeking a career-long match ideally.

items.content:
People + Office Manager

Who we are

We are Tech Nation, the UK Network for ambitious tech entrepreneurs. Our mission is to empower ambitious tech entrepreneurs to grow faster through knowledge and connections. We want to make the UK the best place to imagine, start and grow a digital business to build an economy fit for the next generation. As a high growth startup ourselves, we are a neutral player sitting right at the heart of the ecosystem of high growth digital businesses, policy-makers and corporations.

We empower tech founders to grow faster through our various growth programmes such as Founders’ Network, Upscale, Future Fifty, and Fintech. But not only that, we also offer end-to-end data, insights, stories & resources, a UK wide community that shares the same entrepreneurial culture, and we are the only approved organisation for the Tech Nation Visa scheme rolled out for exceptional talent.

Our Culture:

We are a small but fast growing, high-performance team with high standards and big ambitions. We strive for excellence in everything we do. Our aim is to be transformative and collaborative in our work. We focus on speed, scale, smart resourcefulness and unbounded optimism. We never start with ‘no.’ We’re solution oriented and focus on the outcome and the impact of any project or priority. We’re a curious bunch, creative and a little quirky. We debate things passionately in team meetings and stand-ups. We agree and disagree on how the world should work, but we all agree on making a big difference through our work at Tech Nation. Which is why we love it here and never take it for granted.

Our values are: originality, meaningful collaboration and real impact.

The Role

We are looking for an amazing People and Office Manager to organise and coordinate admin duties and office procedures. This dual role will report into the People Lead and lend support to the various people activities at Tech Nation. Your role is to create and maintain a pleasant work environment, ensuring high levels of organisational effectiveness, communication and safety.

A Day in the Life of a Tech Nation People + Office Manager might look something like this:

The office management side of the role

Serve as the point person for office manager duties including:
Maintenance
Mailing
Supplies
Equipment
Bills
Errands
Shopping
Schedule meetings and appointments
Organise the office layout and order stationery and equipment
Maintain the office condition and arrange necessary repairs
Organise office operations and procedures
Manage contract and price negotiations with office vendors, service providers and office lease
Manage office G&A budget, ensure accurate and timely reporting
Provide general support to visitors
Address employees queries regarding office management issues (e.g. stationery, Hardware and travel arrangements)
Liaise with facility management vendors, including cleaning, catering and security services
Work closely with the Manchester team as well remote workers to ensure they have all they need.

The People side of the role

Support the People Lead to plan in-house or off-site activities, like parties, celebrations and conferences
Own the on-boarding process for new hires
Organise and maintain personnel records
Update our HR system where needed
Participate and support with HR projects
As well as sharing our ambitions and values, you will
Proven work experience as an office manager
Knowledge of office administrator responsibilities, systems and procedures
Proficiency in MS Office (MS Excel and MS Outlook, in particular)
Excellent time management skills and ability to multi-task and prioritize work
Attention to detail and problem-solving skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong organisational and planning skills in a fast-paced environment
A creative mind with an ability to suggest improvements
Experience of working closely with the HR team

What’s in it for you?

Untangl, which include access to a cash plan that covers health, protection and well being.
Perkbox
A shiny new macbook
A 4% employer pension
A flexible work environment
Cycle to work scheme (up to £1,000)
Season ticket loan (up to £5,000)
Quarterly team away days

WHERE TO FROM HERE?

We welcome those with alternative identities, backgrounds, and experiences. Our team includes women, men, mothers, fathers, the self-taught, the university-educated, and people of a wide variety of nationalities, ages, and socio-economic backgrounds.

Obviously, we’re looking to ensure it’s a solid fit from both sides: we want you to step into a role you love, and we want to offer you a place you’re proud to come to every day.

Now that you’re done reading, apply!

* We know that diverse teams are strong teams, and welcome those with alternative identities, backgrounds, and experiences to apply to life at Tech Nation. We are committed to a fair and accessible recruitment process for all candidates. We would be happy to meet any accommodation requests during the application or interview process, please just let us know*.

Senior HR Generalist at TeamSnap

Remote
  • United States
  • Full Time
  • Experienced

Here at TeamSnap we believe that who you work with is just as important as the work you do. We know that culture matters and to build and sustain a strong culture means we need a strong and dedicated team to support these efforts. To continue building our strong culture, we are expanding our people team as we seek to add an experienced and driven Senior HR Generalist (we call it a Sr. People Experience Generalist) to help identify, develop and retain top talent here at TeamSnap. The Senior HR Generalist will be tasked with being the internal champion of TeamSnap recruiting efforts, building and nurturing relationships with team members and managers alike, and identifying where human resources practices can be leveraged to support the business strategies and challenges.

About us
TeamSnap is an award-winning communication and management service for recreational and competitive sports teams, tournaments and organizations. With over 20 million enthusiastic customers in 195 countries, TeamSnap is indispensable for teams, clubs and leagues worldwide.

We value trust, communication and fun more than big company policies and rules, and we thrive on empowering our people instead of controlling them. TeamSnap has been named to Outside Magazine’s list of Best Places to Work three consecutive years.

What you’ll be doing
Here at TeamSnap we’re building a PX team that meets the needs of all employees from top to bottom and across every function. Our goal is to not only recruit the best talent possible, but to nurture and develop them throughout the entire employee life cycle. This role will:

  • Function as our recruiting champion recruiting process from sourcing, screening, interviewing, negotiating offers, and coordinating with contractors and/or consultants who support our recruiting efforts.
  • Ensure the appropriate HR processes are in place to meet compliance requirements and continually strive to improve processes to better streamline operational efficiencies.
  • Partner and advise people leaders and team members on HR related policies, programs, and procedures.
  • Recommends HR approaches and strategies to continually improve departmental efficiency.
  • Support HR programs such as benefits, performance reviews, compensation, and learning & development.
  • Investigate, resolve and coach managers on employee relations issues.
  • Assist with offboarding and other responsibilities related to terminations.
  • Conduct exit interviews and assist in creating effective retention strategies.
  • Maintain employee files and compile reports concerning data such as hires, transfers, performance, etc.
  • Perform presentations on HR compliance topics to ensure the company is in adherence to HR policies, procedures, and programs.
  • Assist with identifying and arranging training needs for employee development.
  • Understands and ensures compliance with federal, state and local HR requirements; communicating potential changes, and advising leadership on needed actions.

Some things that are important:

  • 5+ years of progressive experience in human resources
  • Effective team player and multi-tasker with the ability to prioritize multiple streams of work from multiple sources without sacrificing quality
  • Progressive recruiting experience is a must
  • Has the balance of owning the work, but also playing as a team
  • Well versed in federal, state, and local laws and guidelines relating to employment practices
  • Developed knowledge of HR policies and processes
  • Sense of humor is essential, we work hard so we make sure we have fun doing it
  • Appreciates and facilitates the link between HR and business strategy
  • Ability to identify needs within the business that require HR support
  • Experience building and scaling a rapidly growing team
  • Comfortable providing coaching and feedback to all levels
  • Strong customer service, communication and interpersonal communication skills

Other things that would be nice to have:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources or related field
  • Professional certification in HR (SHRM or HCI)
  • Experience working for a fully remote organization
  • Past work with rapidly scaling SaaS startups
  • Experience working with remote and distributed teams
  • Be a TeamSnap user (sign up for a free trial to see what we’re about)
  • Ability to talk to animals, Doctor Doolittle-style

Location
REMOTE POSITION: We are headquartered in Boulder, Colorado, but this job is remote (unless you happen to live near Boulder, in which case you’re welcome to come to the office). TeamSnap is a mostly-distributed company, so you must be very comfortable working with people who aren’t in the same physical location as you or each other. While we love all parts of the world, we can only hire US-based citizens at this time.

Why TeamSnap?

  • Work on a product that people use and love
  • While we’re still relatively small, we’re not a fly-by-night startup; we’re the leader in a massive market
  • We have a proven revenue model, an experienced executive team, solid funding, and a strong strategic plan
  • We have fantastic benefits, and you’ll have a stake in the company

If you’re looking for an opportunity to show off the very best of your skills, in an environment of trust, respect and flexibility, this might very well be the best job you’ll ever have. We’re passionate about helping our customers spend less time organizing and more time playing.

Benefits and Perks
We offer competitive salary and benefits, lots of opportunity to develop professionally, and the ability to demonstrate what you can achieve. TeamSnap is still small enough that your actions will help drive our success.

Benefits include:

  • Competitive salary
  • Stock options
  • Medical/dental/vision for you and your family
  • Education reimbursement up to $1,500/yr
  • Wellness stipend of $50/mo
  • 401K
  • Free TeamSnap service for your family and friends
  • Free TeamSnap swag.
  • Flexible PTO and vacation policy

Therapy Recruiter at Reliant Rehabilitation

Remote

Corporate TALEN05189

Full-Time

Plano, TX, USA

Job Details

Description

The Recruiter (Therapy) will be based out of our Plano, Texas office or remote and will be responsible for reviewing, screening, and referring applicants for therapy-based positions (physical, occupational, and speech) throughout the company’s facilities. The recruiter will also work with hiring managers in the field to develop recruiting plans to support business need. Considerable skills in interviewing techniques, a good knowledge of healthcare, a basic understanding of the company’s organizational structure as well as an extensive knowledge of personnel policy and procedure and federal and state laws regarding employment practices are essential.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Responsible for full life cycle recruiting, including sourcing, interviewing, and on-boarding
  • Development of recruiting plans, in conjunction with hiring managers.
  • Develops relationships with allied health education providers, and professional associations.
  • Provide consultative support to hiring managers.
  • Responsible for identifying, interviewing, evaluating, and assisting in selection of talent to ensure organizational goals are achieved.
  • Ensure all applicant / new employee documents are received, complete and accurately entered into HRIS system.
  • Act as liaison with area employment agencies, prepare and liaison with advertising agencies, and temporary agencies.
  • Develop and maintain job postings on various recruitment sites (Indeed, LinkedIn, etc).
  • Coordinate attendance at career fairs, job fairs, professional conferences, educational conferences.
  • Complete weekly, monthly and annual reports on recruitment / employment activity.
  • Notify all departments of employee’s hire and start date.
  • Provide all new hire documents to payroll and benefits.
  • Ensure all job postings are posted internally and track internal applicants.
  • Data Entry of HR documents.
  • And other duties as requested.

REQUIREMENTS AND QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience.
  • At least 3 years of experience as an agency/staffing recruiter or corporate recruiter, preferably in healthcare.

The following are personal qualities that will characterize the successful applicant:

  • Excellent presentation skills
  • Superb communication proficiency – both verbal and written.
  • Customer/Client focused.
  • Negotiation and problem-solving skills.
  • Time management and prioritization skills.
  • Thoroughness.
  • Detail orientated.
  • Ability to file, sort, and maintain company/employee data.
  • Ability to create and provide reports and departmental communications.

We are looking for an Operations Manager with strong HR skills to lead our HR team, staff and clients. You will take ownership of all HR matters and related operational processes across the company i.e. from recruitment to performance reviews, contracting & onboarding, wage reviews, disciplinary action, and learning & development. To perform well in this role you should have experience as an HR Manager, or other senior roles in the HR & Ops team, and knowledge around all legal requirements in this role.

Responsibilities:
- Consistently recruiting for excellent staff, anticipate future hiring needs and maintain a consistent pipeline of profiles in demand.
- Attracting suitable candidates through job boards, remote professionals platforms, social media, etc.
- Conducting interviews and sorting through applicants to fill open positions.
- Assessing applicants' knowledge, skills, and experience to best suit open positions.
- Research, create and update skills test task for every position for a smoother recruitment process.
- Promoting the company's reputation and attractiveness as a great company to work for.
- Maintaining a smooth onboarding process, training, counseling and coaching of our staff.
- Resolving conflicts through positive and professional mediation.
- Carrying out necessary administrative duties, conducting performance and wage reviews including the creation of the necessary documentation
- Developing clear policies and ensuring policy awareness.
- Creating clear and concise staff, process and client reports.
- Giving helpful and engaging presentations and explanations of internal processes and best practices.
- Handling disciplinary investigations and contract termination procedures.
- Design user-friendly processes, workflows, guidelines, and documentation
- Team payroll and weekly/monthly hours check
- Supervision of the HR budget and advising the management team on possible optimization

Our mission

The problem: In 2017, nearly 60% of adults in sub-Saharan Africa had no bank account. That's for good reason—the fees are too high, the closest branch can be miles away, and nobody takes cards. Without access to financial institutions, people are forced to keep their savings under the mattress. Small business owners rely on lenders who charge extortionate rates. Parents spend hours waiting in line to pay school fees in cash.

How we're solving it: We're building financial services to work as they should: no account fees, instantly available and accepted everywhere. In places where electricity, water and roads don't always function, we're creating financial infrastructure that "just works." In fall 2017, we launched a mobile app in Senegal for cash deposit, withdrawal, and peer-to-peer and business payments; we're now processing over 200k payments every month. Our goal is to make Africa the first cashless continent.

Our team has doubled in size in the past six months and we are looking to scale team processes to enable even faster growth. That's where you come in...

  • Working with our Finance team to process reimbursements and pay invoices; and
  • Responding to software related queries from team members.

    • Unlimited vacation with a 20-day minimum requirement
    • Wave will cover all costs associated with travel to and from Senegal
    • $10,000 annual charitable donation matching

  • Native or fluent English.
  • Local work authorization (wherever it is you'd like to be based).
  • 3+ years of HR experience.

  • You speak French.

  • Are very organized and detail-oriented - you like to roll up your sleeves and get into the nitty-gritty.
  • Tolerance - dare we say enthusiasm! - for repetitive tasks.
  • Are driven to face tasks head on, complete them efficiently, and move on to the next ones.
  • Are eager to think outside of the box when faced with potential roadblocks.
  • Are tech-savvy [familiar with MS Office, Slack, Google Suite] and feel comfortable troubleshooting tech issues.
  • Have previously worked for a remote company and enjoy working independently.

FundApps is a startup that helps investment managers stay in compliance with global regulations. Our competition is stuck in the dark ages with slow, clunky, complicated user interfaces and installed software. We're shaking up the industry - providing a beautiful & intuitive web-based service which takes away our clients' pains and lets them get on with what they do best.

We've won multiple accolades from organisations such as Wired, World Economic Forum, Deloitte amongst others.

*About Us*
We're a small team (currently 60 people) of smart, friendly people with amazing diversity - 26 nationalities at last count. Our HQ is in London, we have growing offices in New York and Singapore, and remote team members in Copenhagen, Amsterdam and Darlington. We collaborate very closely and take pride in delivering an amazing service to our clients, who are some of the world's largest asset managers, hedge funds and pension funds.

We've successfully bootstrapped our way to profitability, so have an incredible amount of freedom when it comes to creating our own destiny.

Despite the heavyweight clients, we pride ourselves on not taking ourselves too seriously, on doing good by our people, our communities and the environment (we became a B-Corp in 2018) and having bucket-loads of fun along the way!

*The Team*
People Operations (nicknamed POPS internally) was introduced in late 2017 to help smooth the next phase in growth of FundApps as we scale. We’re a two person team currently and take culture super seriously like any growing company worth its salt.

*Rohan* is currently our Talent Partner in London and will soon be focusing on our Learning & Development initiatives including our leadership development, career conversations, early careers, onboarding and general learning content. When Rohan is not at FundApps you’ll find him at a rugby game or training for his next trail marathon.

*Pat* is our Head of People based in New York, and covers a generalist remit including supporting our leadership team, growth planning, reward & payroll and employee relations. Outside of FundApps, you’ll likely find Pat exploring the city, drinking coffee, or planning a return to the tennis court.

Then there’s *YOU!* As our third member of POPS, you’ll be responsible for all recruitment activities across FundApps, including sourcing, branding, recruitment and employer/agency partnerships. We’ve invested heavily in recruitment early in our journey - We have a scalable ATS, an event calendar and university & agency partnerships in place to help source amazing people. Nonetheless, we’re growing quickly and need to continue to raise the bar and deliver a punchy and world-class recruitment and talent process that supports our growth ambitions.

Simply put, your remit will be - *Find the world's most talented people and bring them to FundApps.*

Outside of work, we don’t mind what your interests are, provided you have something you’re passionate about that’s not FundApps! :)

*Responsibilities*
* Talent Sourcing (50%): Partner with team leaders to understand and anticipate hiring needs, build sourcing strategies and scout talent globally across job platforms.
* Recruiting (40%): Build a world-class candidate experience and manage the end to end recruitment cycle. Analyse talent metrics to find scalable improvements in how we recruit the top tech and business talent globally. Deliver at pace, but never at the expense of a personable and authentic experience.
* Employer Branding (10%): Be an ambassador to the FundApps employer brand and active player in industry and recruitment events and meetups and across social media.


*REQUIREMENTS*
* Ideally 2+ years demonstrable experience in an in-house generalist HR, recruitment or talent agency role requiring partnership with hiring managers.
* Flawless written and verbal communication skills and be comfortable talking with people at all levels
* An expert relationship-builder - with hiring managers, agencies, industry reps and candidates.
* Ability to analyse data and metrics of success with an eye for detail

Bonus Points
* Experience in recruiting technical roles, including developers
* Experience managing agency relationships and using hiring platforms
* Master of GIFs, emojis and HR/recruitment puns

*VALUES FIT*

Recruiting and Talent Lead at Tidelift

Remote | Entry-level

What were building
At Tidelift, our mission is making open source software work betterfor everyone. We see a world where open source creators can get paid for doing work they love, and software development teams get software they can depend on. Were already supporting many of the most important projects in open source, and adding more all the time.

We’re still small, but well-funded and growing. You will be able to play a large role in tackling challenging problems and helping build the company, while learning alongside our experienced team.

How you can help

We’re looking for a Recruiting and Talent Lead to build the recruiting programs for Tidelift. As our first dedicated People Operations team member, you will help build an effective, diverse, values-driven team.

You will own our recruiting efforts from beginning to end, including:

  • Work with teams and hiring managers to define roles, and build structured interview materials that help us identify the best candidates (not just the ones who mirror our own biases)
  • Refine and implement our recruiting process, including finding diverse candidates, scheduling interviews, and managing evaluations (screening, internal, and references), and ensuring were using appropriate tooling. (We currently use Google Hire but are open to candidates with other preferences/experience.)
  • Drive the candidate and new employee experience. We consider user experience critical to everything we do, including how we bring people into the company, from the first time they read our job description to the time theyre fully onboarded. Youll help us make that happen in partnership with internal and external resources.
  • Support culture in a time of growth: we plan to more than double in size in 2019. This role will advise and support the leadership team to ensure our culture stays healthy and supportive through that transition.

Prior experience with people operations at a growing startup is a plus, but were open to a candidate who is excited to recruit and can grow into a broader people operations role.

This team

You will be the first hire in our People Ops team. You will collaborate with an experienced leadership team that has seen and managed explosive growth at HubSpot, Red Hat, Wikipedia, and a wide variety of other startups. The role will report to a co-founder, and will also work closely with our head of marketing, who led Red Hats efforts to ensure that the brand and culture were closely intertwined.

Our values

Were trying to build a healthy, values-driven culture. We want to be:

  • Optimistic: We see an amazing future ahead, and want to inspire others to share in it. This is both internalbuilding each other up and looking for the best in peopleand externalwe know open source is awesome, and we want to make it even better.
  • Practical: We know words and ideas alone wont change lives. We help people most by creating a pragmatic, viable, and sustainable business that works for everyone. So we care about usability, design, and honest assessment of costs and benefits.
  • Additive: We want an environment that encourages and inspires growth, both for individuals and for the open source community as a whole. That means embracing a growth mindset, and valuing culture add over culture fit.
  • Inclusive: We believe technology will be stronger when it better reflects the voices and ideas of society as a whole. So we want people from different backgrounds and experiences to not just be represented, but to be heard, valued, and flourish. We do not tolerate discrimination or harassment.

How we work

  • In this role, you can work remotely (within the US) or from our office in downtown Boston. About half of our team, including two of our founders, are remote, and we take employee experience seriously wherever you are based.
  • We believe in the urgency of our mission, and the importance of doing good work, but also know this is a marathon and not a sprint. Hours can be flexible within reason if necessary to meet personal needs (like child, medical, or elder care).

Compensation, benefits, and career

  • Compensation is competitive with other Boston-area startups, including key benefits like health insurance, flexible vacation, 401(k), parental leave, and equity.
  • We are invested in every employees growth, and support professional development that aligns with your goals and how you learn best.

How to apply

Sourcing Operations Associate | programming knowledge required.

Code For Cash recruits software developers in ways that are high-integrity, non-intrusive and mutually profitable, and we are hiring a sourcing operations associate .  In plain English, this means we need someone to find great potential employees for our clients, even if they’re not on the job market.

We need someone who's smart and thinks critically.  We need someone who is punctual and reliable, who gets things done but also has the courage to challenge and improve our processes if they think there is a better way.  We need someone who is hungry for success but has the personal boundaries and self-discipline to lead a sustainable, spiritually fulfilling life. Culturally, it's essential that you have some professional programming experience, either full-time or as a freelancer.  Other than that, there are no rules, and we hope to welcome you into our eclectic culture.

Details

This is a remote job.  You are expected to be available for at least four hours between 10am and 6pm USA Eastern Time.  You must have authorization to work with a USA company but may be located anywhere in the world.

Requirements

  • Native-level English fluency and flawless grammar (it's okay if you're aided by Grammarly, as long as you're consistent in using it!)

  • HTML and CSS knowledge, comfortable adapting responsive templates

  • Power use of web software (i.e. you know the hotkeys for many apps; you are comfortable using Zapier in complex ways if necessary)

  • Experience with Git and GitHub

Compensation

Negotiable, depending on experience.  Equity after standard one-year cliff. Additional equity awards for work that impacts the business at a unit economics level.

Will I belong?

  • Our backgrounds are extraordinarily different; we are united by our love of technology and our desire for independence and freedom.  

  • We’re winners.  Are you as well?

  • We like to work quickly.  Can you keep up?

  • Check out our vibe at https://codefor.cash/aboutus

What’s the impact the company has on the world?  

  • For candidates, we're making it a lot easier to find a great job in tech.

  • For employers, we're making the process of adding a new employee more seamless.

What colleagues am I going to be interacting with day to day, and who benefits from my work?

You're primarily going to be interacting with the client-facing Account Executives. e.g., Zack (https://www.linkedin.com/in/zackburt)

  • Paid training: increase your technical and marketing skills.

  • People are always encouraged to increase their responsibilities as long as their existing responsibilities are well cared for.

What’s work of this position like day to day?

  • Keep your Account Exec in the loop with your progress with 2x daily updates, at the start of the day and at the end of the day.

  • Going through Craigslist, Indeed, GitHub, LinkedIn and searching for professionals that match our clients’ criteria.

  • Update our Operations Associate handbook constantly as we are reassembling the airplane in the air.

  • Building landing pages that properly describe our roles.

  • Launching advertising campaigns to target our candidates.

What am I going to be doing in 6 months?

  • If you are enjoying your position and want work-life balance, you are encouraged to stay in it.

  • If you are ambitious and would like a promotion, you are expected to increasingly automate all aspects of your work and then hire someone to delegate your work to.  Within 6 months, you could be managing an entire team.

How to apply

You'll need a clean, pdf format version of your resume.  Then, take that pdf and convert it into HTML and CSS...nothing fancy, but make the page look exactly like the pdf.  Send an email with your resume in pdf format and a link to the live webpage version. We promise to respond to everyone who applies within these parameters!

Who Are We?

Now that you know we’re not bee obsessed weirdos, you probably want to get to know us a little better (and we’re glad you do!).

Be My Guest is a podcast PR and production agency for entrepreneurs, CEO’s, and experts from all walks of life.

We serve our clients by booking them as guests on podcasts that reach their ideal customers and readers so they can get more publicity, grow their audience, and drive the sales of their products and services.

What We Need

Main Goal: A self-driven and proactive human who meshes well with our ambitious and fun team.

Stretch Goal: The above + someone who gives Ron Burgundy his due respect.

You’ll be helping our clients grow their businesses through podcast guest appearances (these interviews will be listened to by thousands of people).

This is a client facing role (after an initial training period), so having a way with words via email, phone, and handwritten letters is a must.

Specifically, you will help us with:

  • Client Management - Correspond with clients about new interviews you have booked for them, answer any questions they might have, and ensure we are delivering on the results we have guaranteed them
  • Project Management- Keeping our project management systems up to date (Trello/Asana/HubSpot) in real-time so we can best track client deliverables
  • Random Acts of Kindness - Sending handwritten notes + gifts to podcasters and clients

The Starting Line

  • You take pride in creating engaging, creative, and persuasive pitch emails (this will be your primary duty in this role)
  • You have an upbeat, bubbly, and friendly personality that shines through virtual communication. We’re a company run by young, talented, and fun individuals. If you don’t laugh at a good meme or get sarcasm we may not be a great fit.
  • You’re a good human (if you’ve ever kicked an animal that wasn’t attacking you or cursed at a homeless person please don’t apply).
  • On more than one occasion people (not your parents) have complimented how proactive you are.
  • You have internal motivation (we’re a fully remote company that does not micromanage).
  • Must live in the United States.

The Finish Line

  • You can balance multiple projects at the same time (attention to detail test - use the word "apple" somewhere in your application).
  • You know the inner workings of Gmail, Google Calendar, and Google Docs in a way that others may find disturbing.
  • You manage confidentiality without exception. You will be required to sign an NDA, as our client's privacy is very important to us.

The Victory Lap

  • You have experience managing deliverables for multiple clients at once.
  • You’re familiar with Trello, Asana, and/or HubSpot.
  • You’re a podcast fan.

Let’s Talk Benefits & Logistics

  • While we do get together in-person occasionally, we’re primarily a remote company. You can work anywhere you want - from your house, favorite coffee shop, co-working space, etc. :)
  • This is a full-time 40 hour per week contract position that requires the majority of your workday be completed during standard business hours.
  • Unlimited vacation

Corelight

Open source is in our DNA: Corelight was co-founded by the inventor of Zeek along with its key open source committers.

Role

We are seeking a skilled, passionate software developer interested in developing future versions of Zeek with us. You will work on Zeek’s open source code base, developing new features and maintaining existing functionality. You will also interact closely with Zeek’s global user and developer community, integrating feedback & reviewing contributions. Your work will help shape Zeek going forward, and your code will become deployed in some of the most powerful networks.

* Design and develop new features for open source Zeek

* Maintain & modernize Zeek’s existing code base

* Write technical Zeek documentation

* Help maintain Zeek infrastructure & community resources

* Support the open source Zeek community through GitHub, mailing lists, social media

* Participate in Zeek community events

* Collaborate with related open source projects & communities to advance joint interests

* Support integration of Zeek into Corelight products




Qualifications

* Bachelor's degree

* 2+ years of software development in C++ on Unix-style platforms

* Experience programming in standard scripting languages (e.g,. Python) and Unix shells (e.g., bash)

* Experience with common open source development work flows and tools (e.g., GitHub, Git, CMake)




Preferred Qualifications:


* Master’s degree or above, preferably in computer science or related field

* 5+ years of software development in C or C++

* History of substantial contributions to an open source project

* Familiarity with Zeek and, ideally, the Zeek C++ code base

* Experience developing security or networking software, in particular network intrusion detection systems

* Understanding of network protocols and tools for analyzing network traffic (tcpdump, Wireshark, Snort, Suricata)

Working at Corelight

In addition to helping to make networks safer around the world, Corelight is a great place to work. We provide competitive salaries, equity and benefits, but those are just table stakes. No matter where you're based, we aspire to make working here one the best experiences of your career.

Executive Recruiter at BSG Team Ventures

Remote | Part-time

Job Code:BSGExecRecr

Virtual Consulting Role for Boutique Retained Executive Search Firm

PART-TIME (15-30 hours /week average)

WHO WE NEED TO GROW OUR TEAM

BSG Team Ventures is growing and looking to add a few talented Recruiting Consultants.

  • What’s involved in that responsibility?
  • We research, target and reach out to potential executives qualified for those roles on which we’re retained.
  • This position is responsible for screening executives who respond to our overtures and qualifying them further by telephone regarding their fit for the search –competencies that are “must-have’s” in a specific role, motivations they have to consider a change, geographic restrictions/relocatable, current compensation details and needs in considering a new career opportunity.

SPECIFIC SKILLS REQUIRED IN ORDER TO BE SUCCESSFUL?

  • Management Consulting, Human Resources experience with Talent/Recruiting is a big part of the role, as well as Investigative Reporting. In general, we seek someone with a curiosity around talent acquisition and fit, and those who understand and desire a role that engages with smart successful executives who are looking to better their careers with our help and guidance.
  • As mentioned, the “Investigative Reporter” is also a great characteristic in this role. Someone who is comfortable with asking “why,” probing, and exposing the invisible when it comes to an executive’s drive, motivations, and potential culture fit with a given client.

Does this sound like the opportunity for you? Read on.WHAT ISN’T REQUIRED IN THIS ROLE?

  • This is a virtual role. This is not an in person/office-based environment. Telephone connectivity and good Internet broadband speed are critical, however.
  • Prior executive search recruiting experience? While it’s a great “nice-to-have,” we have had great success hiring from a number of backgrounds as noted above.

WHAT BSG TEAM VENTURES PROVIDES?

  • Training on our specific process and methodology, cloud-based project management and candidate management system, and other necessary infrastructure.

TIME REQUIREMENTS:

  • We need a minimum of 15 hours a week. While hours flex, maximum is typically 25-30 hours in any given week.
  • Note that most of this position’s time is spent in half-hour candidate discovery and screening calls, so availability both during work hours and some after-hours can be important.

COMPENSATION:

  • Compensation is on an hourly basis, and commensurate with a consultant’s experience and skills.

WHO WE ARE?

BSG Team Ventures was founded in 1997 as Boston Search Group and rebranded in 2008. We’re a professional services firm, focused on retained executive search, recruiting leaders for rapidly changing environments

WHO ARE OUR CLIENTS?

BSG Team Ventures serves a wide range of clients, including public corporations and not-for-profit organizations. However, the greatest concentration of BSG’s work is with private equity firms and their portfolio companies to expand or upgrade management, and with venture capital firms and entrepreneurs to build teams for early-stage businesses. We build executive teams for investor-backed businesses–middle market private equity, lower-middle market growth equity, and venture capital backed in industries spanning the manufacturing, services, technology, restaurant, and energy sectors. Over the past 20 years, BSG principals – working from offices in Boston, San Francisco, and London – have completed more than 500 assignments for board directors, C-level executives, and VPs in every major functional area.
